title: Head of Growth
fit reason: Good analytics/A-B testing background but early-career—lacks senior paid-acquisition, consumer app growth, YouTube expertise, and leadership required for Head of Growth.
role description: Wonder Studios, a next-generation film studio combining cinematic craft with AI, is hiring a Head of Growth (London, hybrid) to own and scale user acquisition for the Wonder Studios App. This senior, hands-on role will build paid acquisition strategies and growth loops (with emphasis on YouTube), work closely with Product, Engineering and Creative teams, and grow into a leadership function.
role responsibilities: ['Own the end-to-end user acquisition funnel and define KPIs for acquisition, activation, and retention', 'Build and execute paid media and performance marketing (SEO, Meta, Google, etc.) with a focus on efficiency', 'Design and grow a hybrid paid and organic YouTube strategy', 'Implement analytics, attribution and experimentation frameworks (A/B testing) and translate results into action', 'Embed growth loops into the product/UX through close collaboration with Product, Engineering and Creative teams', 'Apply AI/ML domain insight to identify and capitalise on growth opportunities', 'Start as a hands-on operator with a trajectory to hire and lead the Growth function']
role reqs: ['Substantial experience and demonstrable success in a senior Growth or Performance role, ideally scaling a consumer app or platform', 'Strong analytical skills and comfort managing performance metrics, attribution and reporting', 'Hands-on acquisition expertise across channels (paid and organic), including performance marketing', 'Experience with experimentation and optimisation (A/B testing) and turning data into actionable insights', 'Familiarity with the AI/Machine Learning landscape and its application to creative technology', 'Leadership capability to hire, mentor and run a high-performing growth team', 'Ability to collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Engineering and Creative teams']

title: GTM Associate
fit reason: Strong GTM/ops, pitching, and stakeholder coordination skills but lacks the 3–5 years of agency/creative production and direct ad/client-management experience the role expects.
role description: Wonder Studios, an AI-native film and content studio in Los Angeles, is hiring a GTM Associate to grow and manage US agency and brand partnerships for advertising and brand-led work. The hybrid sales-and-execution role spans inbound and outbound business development, pitching and proposal assembly, client management, delivery coordination, and developing GTM playbooks and operations.
role responsibilities: ['Manage inbound advertising and brand-led briefs: assess fit, gather requirements, and coordinate internal responses across creative and production', 'Support outbound business development with agencies, brands, and creative partners to grow Wonder’s US presence', 'Build and define Wonder’s advertising GTM playbook, tools, and supporting materials', 'Serve as day-to-day client contact, maintain relationships, and ensure clear communication and strong delivery from brief through final delivery', 'Assemble proposals, pitch decks, timelines, creative/production assets, and lead RFP coordination and submission', 'Maintain CRM and pipeline tracking to move opportunities through the funnel', 'Support internal alignment across Creative, Production, and GTM and develop scalable systems, templates, and workflows', 'Represent Wonder at industry events, agency visits, and creative gatherings']
role reqs: ['3-5 years experience in advertising, client management, partnerships, production, or account management within a creative agency, production company, or media-tech environment', 'Client-focused, high-agency, with intellectual curiosity and agility to work in an AI-native studio', 'Strong understanding of brand campaigns, agency workflows, and creative production processes', 'Experience assembling proposals, pitch materials, timelines, and managing RFPs', 'Ability to maintain CRM/pipeline and coordinate cross-functional teams', 'Excellent communication and relationship-management skills; comfortable representing the company externally']

title: Creative Technologist
fit reason: Strong analytics/AI background but lacks studio/agency creative portfolio, art-direction, motion and generative-AI tooling experience; role is production-focused vs the candidate’s business/strategy goals.
role description: Creative Technologist role at Wonder Studios, an AI-native creative studio. The hands-on position works with the Creative Director and Head of Production to develop and execute concept-driven, AI-first visual content across music videos, advertising, long-form and experimental projects, helping shape creative workflows and studio direction.
role responsibilities: ['Execute creative development for original IP, branded content, and brand partnerships across film, episodic, and short-form media.', 'Conceptualise and produce storyboards, pitch decks, animatics, and concept trailers using both AI and traditional tools.', 'Experiment with and apply emerging AI technologies for production, previsualisation, and post-production workflows.', 'Integrate AI tools across the creative pipeline to increase speed and expand visual possibilities from ideation to delivery.', 'Collaborate with the Creative Director, Head of Production, and a network of freelance and in-house creatives.', 'Translate client briefs into compelling visual concepts and narratives that leverage AI to enhance campaigns.', "Stay current on content and AI trends and bring insights to the studio's creative approach.", 'Help structure and scale creative workflows to maintain efficiency while preserving experimentation.']
role reqs: ['2–4 years experience in agency, studio, content, or tech creative roles.', 'Portfolio demonstrating strong conceptual thinking, visual sensibility, storytelling, and ideally integrated AI work.', 'Strong art direction skills and experience across visual and motion formats.', 'Hands-on experience with generative AI tools (e.g., Midjourney, Runway, Kling, Flux, Comfy AI or similar).', 'Experience on multi-platform campaigns, digital content, and brand systems.', 'Ability to work in fast, iterative environments and balance speed with creative standards.', 'Confident presenting work to clients and internal stakeholders.', 'Proficiency with Canva, Notion, and Google Slides.']

title: Creative Technologist
fit reason: Strong technical/analysis background but lacks creative-studio experience, art-direction/visual portfolio and hands-on generative-AI production work required.
role description: Creative Technologist role at Wonder, an AI-native creative studio in London (hybrid). Hands-on position working with the Creative Director and Head of Production to develop and execute AI-first visual storytelling across music videos, advertising, long-form and experimental projects. Responsible for contributing to pitches, leading creative deliverables, integrating generative AI into workflows, and helping shape the studio’s creative approach and growth.
role responsibilities: ['Execute creative development for agency-facing work, original IP, branded content and brand partnerships across film, episodic and short-form media.', 'Conceptualise and produce storyboards, pitch decks, animatics and concept trailers using AI and traditional creative tools.', 'Experiment with emerging AI technologies for production, previsualisation and post-production.', 'Support integration of AI tools across the creative pipeline from ideation to delivery to increase speed and visual possibilities.', 'Collaborate closely with the Creative Director and Head of Production to shape creative solutions.', 'Lead execution of creative deliverables, contribute to pitches and cultivate a fast, experimental creative culture.', 'Work alongside and support freelance and in-house creatives (writers, editors, designers, AI technologists).', 'Translate client briefs into compelling visual concepts and narratives leveraging AI.', 'Monitor trends in content and AI and help structure and scale efficient creative workflows.']
role reqs: ['2–4 years experience in creative roles within agency, studio, content or tech environments.', 'Portfolio demonstrating sharp conceptual thinking, strong visuals and ideally integrated AI work.', 'Strong art direction skills and an eye for storytelling across visual and motion formats.', 'Experience with generative AI tools (e.g., Midjourney, Runway, Kling, Flux, Comfy AI or similar).', 'Experience working on multi-platform campaigns, digital content and brand systems.', 'Ability to execute projects in fast, iterative environments and balance speed with creative standards.', 'Confident presenting work and ideas to clients and internal stakeholders.', 'Proficiency with Canva, Notion and Google Slides.', 'Bias for action, strong creative aesthetic and ability to bring structure and direction to projects.']

title: Founding Account Executive
role description: Early-stage AI infrastructure startup Runlayer is hiring a Founding Account Executive to be the first sales hire and drive outbound growth. The role focuses on sourcing meetings and closing early enterprise deals to connect AI agents to systems securely via the Model Context Protocol (MCP), working closely with founders and engineers.
role responsibilities: ['Source and qualify meetings with senior leaders at Fortune 500 and high-growth enterprises through outbound prospecting, events, and other channels', 'Manage the full sales cycle for early-stage deals from first touch to signed contract, collaborating with founders and engineers', 'Craft, refine, and iterate on the company pitch based on prospect feedback', 'Build and document a repeatable outbound motion and outreach strategies to scale GTM', 'Represent Runlayer at events, conferences, and customer meetings (NYC, SF and beyond)']
role reqs: ['Hunter mentality with strong preference for outbound prospecting', '4+ years of experience in outbound sales, BDR/SDR, or AE roles at high-growth SaaS or infrastructure companies', 'Proven track record of quota overachievement (e.g., President’s Club or equivalent)', 'Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills', 'Persistence and hustle — comfortable with multiple follow-ups and proactive outreach (phone/email)', 'Learning mindset and willingness to dive deep into enterprise AI technical and business conversations', 'Preferred/bonus: experience selling developer tools, infrastructure, or security products', 'Preferred/bonus: existing network in enterprise IT, security, or AI', 'Preferred/bonus: track record closing six-figure deals at an early stage', 'Preferred/bonus: expert-level use of AI tools for prospecting and outreach']
